!hashes: use gksudo with gedit (and other gui apps)
what is the output of:  file `which gedit`
is your user in the admin group?
if you run:  groups | grep admin     do you get an output?
is your user in the admin group?
if you are not in the admin group, you can't use sudo
ok what is the output of: lsb_release -sc
what is the output of:  ls -l `which sudo`
did you put the backticks as I used?
hold shift at boot and select recovery mode, then select root, you can now run:  passwd foo; reboot     change foo for your username
try resetting password in root recovery, may help
